title: 107_hr3265
content: The "Social Security Disability Waiting Period Repeal Act of 2001" eliminates the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits. The "Social Security Disability Waiting Period Repeal Act of 2001" eliminates the waiting period for disability benefits under the Social Security Act. The "Social Security Disability Waiting Period Repeal Act of 2001" eliminates the waiting period for disability benefits under the Social Security Act. Section 223 of the Act is amended to remove certain defined terms and make conforming amendments. Section 223(c)(1) of the Social Security Act is amended to clarify the application of subparagraph (B). Additionally, Section 202(e)(1)(F) is revised regarding Widow's Insurance Benefits Based on Disability. The Social Security Act is amended to redesignate paragraphs and eliminate defined terms related to widower's insurance benefits based on disability. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for the commencement of periods of disability. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for the commencement of periods of disability. The amendments in this Act apply to specific benefits under the Social Security Act, with different effective dates for each type of benefit.
